In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the **hash mark** (**#**) serves the following purposes:

- Press [#]() to enter a specific [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command"). Note that "#" cannot be the first character of the name of any [NetHackWiki](/wiki/NetHackWiki "NetHackWiki") article, requiring it to be omitted from the title of extended command articles.

- On the [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") screen, `#` denotes a skill that cannot be #[enhanced](/wiki/Enhance "Enhance") any further.

- \# can represent one of many [dungeon features](/wiki/Dungeon_feature "Dungeon feature"):

  - \# # [corridor](/wiki/Corridor "Corridor")
  - \# [tree](/wiki/Tree "Tree")
  - \# [cloud](/wiki/Cloud "Cloud")
  - \# [poison cloud](/wiki/Poison_cloud "Poison cloud")
  - \# [sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink")
  - \# [iron bars](/wiki/Iron_bars "Iron bars")

- In the [inventory](/wiki/Inventory "Inventory"), # is used as an overflow character for items that are picked up when every other inventory letter is in use - in practice, this typically occurs with a picked-up [loadstone](/wiki/Loadstone "Loadstone"), which ignores the inventory letter limit that would prevent you picking up most additional items. Boulders picked up while in the form of a [giant](/wiki/Giant "Giant") or [titan](/wiki/Titan "Titan") are also given hash mark slots in the inventory if all other letters are in use.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The glyph used for a sink is now {.

## Variants

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [Tobiume](/index.php?title=Tobiume\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Tobiume (page does not exist)") is capable of stealing weapons from monsters and adding them to your inventory: if all other inventory letters are in use, these weapons are given # slots as normal.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), your [wallet](/wiki/Wallet "Wallet") uses a lettered inventory slot like other items, including using # in the absence of any available inventory letters.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Hash mark

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the hash mark (#) serves the following purposes:

  • Press # to enter a specific extended command. Note that "#" cannot be the first character of the name of any NetHackWiki article, requiring it to be omitted from the title of extended command articles.
  • On the skill screen, # denotes a skill that cannot be #enhanced any further.
  • # can represent one of many dungeon features:
    • # # corridor
    • # tree
    • # cloud
    • # poison cloud
    • # sink
    • # iron bars
  • In the inventory, # is used as an overflow character for items that are picked up when every other inventory letter is in use - in practice, this typically occurs with a picked-up loadstone, which ignores the inventory letter limit that would prevent you picking up most additional items. Boulders picked up while in the form of a giant or titan are also given hash mark slots in the inventory if all other letters are in use.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

The glyph used for a sink is now {.

Variants

dNetHack

In dNetHack, Tobiume is capable of stealing weapons from monsters and adding them to your inventory: if all other inventory letters are in use, these weapons are given # slots as normal.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, your wallet uses a lettered inventory slot like other items, including using # in the absence of any available inventory letters.

rawPage:
{{ASCII}}
In ''[[NetHack]]'', the '''hash mark''' ('''#''') serves the following purposes:

* Press {{kbd|#}} to enter a specific [[extended command]]. Note that "#" cannot be the first character of the name of any [[NetHackWiki]] article, requiring it to be omitted from the title of extended command articles.
* On the [[skill]] screen, <tt>#</tt> denotes a skill that cannot be #[[enhance]]d any further.
* {{white|#}} can represent one of many [[dungeon feature]]s:
** {{lightgray|#}} {{white|#}} [[corridor]]
** {{green|#}} [[tree]]
** {{lightgray|#}} [[cloud]]
** {{brightgreen|#}} [[poison cloud]]
** {{lightgray|#}} [[sink]]
** {{cyan|#}} [[iron bars]]
* In the [[inventory]], {{white|#}} is used as an overflow character for items that are picked up when every other inventory letter is in use - in practice, this typically occurs with a picked-up [[loadstone]], which ignores the inventory letter limit that would prevent you picking up most additional items. Boulders picked up while in the form of a [[giant]] or [[titan]] are also given hash mark slots in the inventory if all other letters are in use.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|The glyph used for a sink is now {{white|{}}.}}

==Variants==
===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[Tobiume]] is capable of stealing weapons from monsters and adding them to your inventory: if all other inventory letters are in use, these weapons are given {{white|#}} slots as normal.

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], your [[wallet]] uses a lettered inventory slot like other items, including using {{white|#}} in the absence of any available inventory letters.
{{nethack-367}}
